content: cloud nap mask a cozy double-layered sleep mask born above the clouds designed by @alesiastrickt the cloud nap mask was designed somewhere above the clouds it began as an improvised in-flight project when the sunlight streaming through the window made sleep impossible with only a skein of sock yarn on hand this quick little pattern was born midair the mask is worked in the round to create a double-layered fabric for extra softness and comfort shaping is achieved with symmetrical increases and decreases across both layers the front and back are then joined using the kitchener stitch and the look is completed with an i-cord band that fits comfortably around the head it s a fast relaxing knit perfect for travel using up leftover sock yarn or making a thoughtful handmade gift 1 size one size dimensions width 17 cm height 10 cm gauge 32 sts × 40 row = 10 × 10 cm 4 × 4 in in stockinette stitch worked on 2 5 mm us 1½ needles after washing and blocking needles 2 5 mm us 1½ circular needles 60 80 cm long if using the magic loop method or a set of five 2 5 mm us 1½ double-pointed needles 15 or 20 cm long yarn approx 15 20 g of fingering-weight sock yarn ≈ 50 g / 200 m suggested yarns filcolana arwetta 50 g / 210 m or lamana merida 50 g / 200 m pattern using your preferred regular cast-on method cast on 30 stitches while judy s magic cast-on may seem more seamless i recommend using a classic cast-on it gives the edges a cleaner more defined look and makes them less stretchy if using the magic loop method divide the stitches evenly 15 on each needle if working on four needles arrange them as 7 / 8 / 7 / 8 stitches per needle abbreviations used m1l lift the strand between stitches from front to back with the left needle and knit through the back loop creates a left-leaning increase m1r lift the strand between stitches from back to front with the left needle and knit through the front loop creates a right-leaning increase k2tog knit two stitches together as one through the front loops creates a right-leaning decrease ssk slip two stitches knitwise one at a time then insert the left needle through the front of both slipped stitches and knit them together creates a left-leaning decrease begin working in rounds pattern includes both written instructions and a stitch chart for convenience stitch chart is on page 5 2 round 1 knit all stitches round 2 k1
